Label: Lawsuit filed opposing the movement of "Unite the Right" rally
Description: Jason Kessler, organizer of the "Unite the Right" rally, files a federal lawsuit against the city of Charlottesville, Virginia after they move his white nationalist demonstration from Emancipation Park to McIntire Park.

Label: State police and National Guard
Description: Virginia Gov. Terry McAuliffe declares via Twitter that the Virginia State Police, National Guard and others will be "on the scene in a support capacity."

Label: University of Virginina march begins
Description: A group of white nationalists carrying torches marched through the University of Virginia's campus in Charlottesville, Virginia.

Label: Signer condems UVA march
Description: The mayor of Charlottesville called the gathering a "cowardly parade of hatred, bigotry, racism, and intolerance."

Label: Court rules Emancipation Park
Description: A federal judge rules in favor of Kessler; the Saturday event is to be held in Emancipation Park.

Label: White nationals and counter-protestors arrive
Description: The rallying white nationalists and a group of counter-protesters arrive at the park long before the event's scheduled start time.

Label: White nationals and counter-protestors clash
Description: Violence breaks out between protesters and counter-protesters. Virginia Police say there are two people who have injuries that are "serious but not life-threatening."

Label: Unlawful assembly
Description: Law enforcement declares the gathering an "unlawful assembly"

Label: State of emergency
Description: Governor announces a "state of emergency.”

Label: Trump tweents condemnation
Description: President Donald Trump takes to Twitter to offer a generic condemnation of the conflict that is unfolding.

Label: Counter-protestors targeted with vehicle
Description: A Dodge Challenger rams into a group of counter-protesters, killing one 32-year-old woman and injuring at least 19 others.

Label: Trump blames "many sides"
Description: Trump speaks from his vacation in Bedminster, New Jersey; condemning the violence, he says blame for the events lay on "many sides." The sweeping statement earned him criticism from some parties and placed pressure on fellow Republicans to more vehemently condemn the racist viewpoints behind the rally.

Label: Helicopter crash
Description: A Virginia State Police helicopter crashed near Charlottesville, killing the two state troopers riding inside. Officials immediately link the incident to the violence resulting from the rally. Details later released by the National Transportation Safety Board reveal the purpose of the flight was to provide a video feed of activities on the ground; disaster struck shortly after the chopper left "mission-related activities" in downtown Charlottesville.

Label: Obama quotes Mandela
Description: Former president Barack Obama's Twitter response to the Charlottesville rally, in which he posted a quote from Nelson Mandela, receives over 4 million 'likes' and becomes the most 'liked' tweet ever.

Label: Marco Rubio tells Trump to act
Description: Marco Rubio tweets “Very important for the nation to hear @potus describe events in #Charlottesville for what they are, a terror attack by #whitesupremacists”

Label: Governor McAuliffe condems white supremacists
Description: Speaking at a press conference, Gov. McAuliffe vehemently condemns the white supremacists allied with "United the Right" and commands them unequivocally: "Go home."

Label: James Alexander Fields Jr. is identifyed
Description: The man suspected to be behind the wheel in the car-ramming is identified as James Alexander Fields, Jr. Law enforcement announces three others have been arrested as well.

Label: Department of Justice launches an investigation
Description: The Department of Justice has opened a civil rights investigation into the car-ramming, Trump said.

Label: Jason Kressler's press conference
Description: "Unite the Right" leader Kessler attempts to hold a press conference in Charlottesville. It doesn't go well; a man is arrested for "spitting" in his face.

Label: Rallies and vigils
Description: Rallies and vigils are held across the country in honor of the three dead and dozens more injured.

Label: Marcus Martin
Description: In Charlottesville, Marcus Martin, also hit by Fields, asks: "Who is accountable for Heather's life?"

Label: Violence nationwide
Description: In Seattle and elsewhere, some demonstrations turn violent, with protesters clashing with police.

Label: Fields appears in court
Description: James Alex Fields, Jr., makes his first court appearance. No bond is set for the suspect.

Label: Fields obsession with Nazism
Description: More details come out about Fields, the suspect in the car-ramming. His classmates and teachers say he has always been obsessed with Nazism.

Label: Trump says "racism is evil"
Description: Trump makes a stronger statement against the violence, this time from the White House. "Racism is evil," the president said.

Label: Former Presidents denounce racism
Description: Regarding the earlier violence in Charlottesville, former presidents George H.W. Bush and George W. Bush call upon incumbent President Trump to "reject racial bigotry, anti-Semitism and hatred in all forms."

Label: Vigil honors those killed/injured
Description: Vigil held for Heather and two state troopers by residents and UVA students in Charlottesville. The ceremony was spread by word of mouth, not through the internet.

Label: Mass resignation on Committee of the Arts and Humanities
Description: A mass resignation of the President's Committee on the Arts and Humanities is made in protest against Trump's response to the Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville, Virginia.

Label: Signer asks for special sessions
Description: Mayor Mike Signer asked the governor of Virginia to call a special session to look into allowing local government more authority when deciding what to do with confederate monuments.

Label: Governor McAuliffe denies special sessions
Description: Governor McAuliffe said he would not call the session because of the lawsuit surrounding the statue.

Label: Steve Bannon fired
Description: Steve Bannon is fired from his positions as the White House Chief Strategist and Senior Counselor to the President. In a statement later, he says "The Trump presidency we fought for and won is over. We still have this huge movement, and there'll be good days and bad days, but that presidency is over."

Label: Boston counter-protestors
Description: Up to 30,000 people gather on Boston Common to protest a right-wing rally, motivated in part as a response to the recent Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville.

Label: Mnuchin defends Trump
Description: Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin publicly defended President Trump’s response to Yale classmates and Jewish critics in the most vociferous defense of the President since the “Unite to Right” protest.
